meanings.definition: Not supported or backed by evidence or authority.
meanings.sent1: The wild claim was quickly dismissed as unsupported by any facts.
meanings.sent2: The bridge collapsed due to the unsupported weight of the truck.
meanings.sent3: The unsupported theory that cats can fly made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like an unsupported tower, ready to crumble at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The unsupported argument fell apart under scrutiny.

meanings.definition: Not held up or sustained by any external means.
meanings.sent1: The shelf was wobbly and unsupported on one side.
meanings.sent2: The unsupported roof began to sag under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent3: The unsupported ladder swayed dangerously in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His dreams felt like an unsupported bridge, shaky and uncertain.
meanings.sent5: The unsupported structure collapsed with a loud crash.

meanings.definition: Not provided with help or assistance.
meanings.sent1: The student felt unsupported in his struggle to understand the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The athlete performed an unsupported stunt without any safety gear.
meanings.sent3: The unsupported team tried their best but couldn't win the game.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt heavy and unsupported in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The unsupported child longed for someone to lend a helping hand.
